newsitem.title: UK: NWE gas oil barge premiums ease amid scant demand.
newsitem.headline: NWE gas oil barge premiums ease amid scant demand.

text.p: NWE gas oil eased on Friday as sellers were forced to respond to scant buying interest by lowering offers.
Heating oil barges were traded weaker at June IPE +$1.50 and $1.25 a tonne cif Rotterdam, although one buyer with a very prompt requirement paid +$2.00 a tonne for a barge loading over the weekend.
First-half June barges were offered at June IPE +$1.75 a tonne.
"The turnover has been very light this week, and now buyers will want to wait to see if prices go even lower," said one barge dealer.
Underlying IPE futures were also softer, with the June contract trading down $1.75 a tonne at $177.25 at 1116 GMT.
Discussion on diesel barges was weaker, with offers at June IPE +$9.75 a tonne in Rotterdam and +$8.75 in Antwerp.
The Russian cargo market was seen pressured after three cargoes were traded into ARA on Thursday at around June IPE +$2.00.
